page.title: 19FARMING YEAR CONTINUED
page.content: After the planting there is not so much to do, so now manure is spread onto the grass fields to make the grass grow better and more healthily for both silage making and stock grazing. {SPRING. Spring is not very busy on arable farms as there are few sheep, and the crops should be growing well. If they get any mildew or any other kind of disease then the farmer puts a fungicide on the field to kill them off and then puts some fertilizer on them to perk them up a bit. {SUMMER.} Summer is very busy because of the harvest. Harvesting of barley begins towards the end of July, and wheat follows shortly afterwards, then oats and then peas. Harvesting is usually done with a combine, then bali
